summary: An FBI internal email from September 2019 providing a financial update on the Epstein investigation. It lists subpoenas served and productions received from financial institutions, including specific mentions of subpoenas related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Addressed in the email as the recipient of the requested financial update.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of subpoenas served to PayPal/Venmo and MoneyGram, with one production returning no records.

connections.description: Sean, an FBI agent, is receiving an update on financial subpoenas related to the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Financial Investigation Update
events.description: An FBI agent provides an update on subpoenas served and productions received from financial institutions as part of the Epstein investigation, including those targeting Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: FBI New York Field Office 26 Federal Plaza NYC, NY 10278
keyFacts: Subpoenas were served to PayPal/Venmo, Experian, MoneyGram, and JP Morgan Chase as part of the Epstein financial investigation.
At least one subpoena was specifically for Ghislaine Maxwell's financial records via PayPal/Venmo.
A MoneyGram subpoena for Ghislaine Maxwell returned no records found.
The document indicates active financial forensic work was being conducted by the FBI New York Field Office in September 2019.
